intro: Tragopogon bjelorussicus, commonly known as the Belarusian thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, followed by the development of bristly, spiky seed heads. Tragopogon bjelorussicus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
